tagPage.description1: A tag is a keyword or label that categorizes your question with other, similar questions.
tagPage.description2: Using the right tags makes it easier for others to find and answer your question.

tagList.javascript: For questions regarding programming in ECMAScript (JavaScript/JS) and its various dialects/implementations (excluding ActionScript). Please include all relevant tags on your question.
tagList.python: Python is a multi-paradigm, dynamically typed, multipurpose programming language. It is designed to be quick to learn, understand, and use, and enforces a clean and uniform syntax.
tagList.csharp: C# (pronounced 'see sharp') is a high level, statically typed, multi-paradigm programming language developed by Microsoft.
tagList.java: Java is a high-level object oriented programming language. Use this tag when you're having problems using or understanding the language itself.
tagList.php: PHP is a widely used, open source, general-purpose, multi-paradigm, dynamically typed and interpreted scripting language originally designed for server-side web development.
tagList.html: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the markup language for creating web pages and other information to be displayed in a web browser.
tagList.android: Android is Google's mobile operating system, used for programming or developing digital devices (Smartphones, Tablets, Automobiles, TVs, Wear, Glass, IoT).
tagList.css: CSS is a representation style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of HTML, XML documents and SVG elements including colors, layout, fonts, and animations.
tagList.reactjs: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It uses a declarative, component-based paradigm and aims to be both efficient and flexible.
tagList.nodejs: Node.js is an event-based, non-blocking, asynchronous I/O runtime that uses Google's V8 JavaScript engine and libuv library.
